glsa.title: KDE Systemsettings: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: Data validation in KDE Systemsettings could lead to local privilege escalation.

background.p: KDE workspace configuration module for setting the date and time has a helper program which runs as root for performing actions.

description.p: KDE Systemsettings fails to properly validate user input before passing it as argument in context of higher privilege.

impact.p: A local attacker could gain privileges via a crafted ntpUtility (ntp utility name) argument.

workaround.p: Add a polkit rule to disable the org.kde.kcontrol.kcmclock.save action.

resolution.p: All KDE Systemsettings users should upgrade to the latest version:
